Plot: A stylish and faithful adaptation of Edgar Allan Poe&#039;s classic short story. Narrated in first-person by James Mason, the main character calmly tells of an unnatural revulsion with his landlord&#039;s "strange" eye that leads him to murder the landlord and hide his dismembered body under the floorboards of a rooming house. Sticking closely to Poe&#039;s remarkable portrait of madness, the film makes extraordinary use of abstract design and (originally) stereoscopic 3-D depth to heighten the suspense and insight of the story.
